meanings.definition: To date (an event or object) as earlier than is actually the case.
meanings.sent1: She mistakenly foredated the historical document.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist foredated the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent3: By foredating the party invitation, she accidentally caused confusion.
meanings.sent4: His excitement for the concert foredated the actual event.
meanings.sent5: Foredating the deadline helped her plan ahead effectively.

meanings.definition: To establish the date of (an event or object) as occurring before a particular time.
meanings.sent1: The scientist foredated the discovery of the fossil.
meanings.sent2: Foredating the invention of the wheel is a challenging task.
meanings.sent3: Foredating the birthday surprise made the celebration even more special.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition seemed to foredate the upcoming changes in the company.
meanings.sent5: The old map foredated the construction of the new bridge.
